movie_title: Genetic Engineering and Diseases – Gene Drive & Malaria
introduction: We have the choice to attack one of our oldest enemies with genetic engineering. But should we do it

vocabulary.definition: an organism that lives in or on another organism (its host) and benefits by deriving nutrients at the other's expense
vocabulary.example: Malaria is caused by a parasite that relies on mosquitoes to complete its life cycle.

vocabulary.definition: to completely destroy or get rid of something
vocabulary.example: The new technology aims to eradicate malaria by targeting the mosquitoes that carry the disease.

vocabulary.definition: the complete set of genes or genetic material present in a cell or organism
vocabulary.example: Scientists are studying the mosquito's genome to understand how to genetically modify them to combat diseases.

vocabulary.definition: involving or causing a complete or dramatic change
vocabulary.example: CRISPR technology is considered revolutionary in the field of genetic engineering for its precision and efficiency.
The use of gene drive technology to alter mosquito populations is unprecedented in the fight against vector-borne diseases.

vocabulary.definition: relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these
vocabulary.example: There are ethical considerations to be taken into account when deciding to genetically modify organisms for disease control.
